meanings.definition: A literary work of low quality produced quickly for profit.
meanings.sent1: The author churned out another potboiler to make some quick cash.
meanings.sent2: The bookstore had a whole section dedicated to potboilers.
meanings.sent3: The potboiler was so poorly written that it became unintentionally hilarious.
meanings.sent4: Her latest novel was criticized for being a mere potboiler with no depth.
meanings.sent5: The film adaptation of the potboiler failed to capture the essence of the original story.

meanings.definition: A painting or other work of art produced quickly and easily to make money.
meanings.sent1: The artist painted several potboilers to sell at the local art fair.
meanings.sent2: The gallery featured a collection of colorful potboilers.
meanings.sent3: The potboiler was so simple that even a child could recreate it.
meanings.sent4: His latest artwork was dismissed as a mere potboiler lacking creativity.
meanings.sent5: The art collector refused to buy the potboiler, deeming it unworthy of his collection.

meanings.definition: Something, such as a movie or book, that is produced quickly and easily to make money.
meanings.sent1: The film studio decided to release a potboiler to attract a larger audience.
meanings.sent2: The bookstore shelves were filled with cheap potboilers.
meanings.sent3: The potboiler movie was so predictable that the audience started laughing.
meanings.sent4: The author's reputation suffered after publishing too many potboilers.
meanings.sent5: Despite being a potboiler, the book managed to become a bestseller.
